column17: The attack took place in Sibenik.
column18: 07/21/2009: On Tuesday, in Sibenik, Dalmatia, Croatia, assailants detonated a explosive device attached to a vehicle, injuring two Austrians, a Croatian and damaged one car. All three injured were treated in the hospital, but were not seriously hurt. The explosion was believed to be linked to a dispute between local politicians, but no motive was reported and no group has claimed responsibility.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: Unknown explosives were used in the attack.
column108: The attack caused property damage to one car.
column127: \"\"Three Injured in Car Bomb Explosion in Croatia"
column131: \"\"Explosive Device Wounds Three in Croatia's Sibenik"
column135: \"\"Three Injured in Car Bomb Explosion in Croatia"

column17: The incident occurred in the Podsused area of the city.
column18: 01/09/2013: An explosive device detonated on the railway tracks at Podsused train station in Zagreb city, City of Zagreb county, Croatia. There were no reported casualties, although the track, a cargo train engine, and nearby buildings were damaged in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however one person was taken into custody for the incident and a similar attack several days later.
column97: A pressure-triggered explosive device was used in the attack.
column108: Train tracks, the engine of a vehiclego train, and windows of nearby buildings were damaged in this attack.
column125: The assailant was taken into custody for this incident and a similar one that occurred on January 11, 2013. Although this second incident (201301110024) does not meet the criteria for a coordinated attack, the two incidents are related. There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. Authorities suspected that the attack was criminal in nature.
column132: 2013.\",\"\"\"Powerful blast hits railway tracks near Zagreb"

column17: The incident occurred on Aleja Bologna Street
column18: 01/11/2013: An explosive device detonated at a bus stop in Aleja Bologna area, Zagreb city, City of Zagreb county, Croatia. One person, the suspected bomber, was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however the injured person was taken into custody for the incident and a similar attack several days earlier.
column125: The assailant was taken into custody for this incident and a similar one that occurred on January 9, 2013. Although the second incident (201301090007) does not meet the criteria for a coordinated attack, the two incidents are related.
